intro: Milium capense, commonly known as the Cape milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible parts. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, and it has slender, upright stems. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Milium capense is often found in grasslands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
